channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Unusual pot hole near drain. Risk of collapse?, 24th April
item.description:
On the road outside number 1 Wimborne Close. The tarmac beside the drain appears to have worn away so there is a big gap under the top layer of road. Looks like there is nothing underneath to support the road!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Wimborne Close, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car driving on grass, no dropped curb damaging green area., 23rd April
item.description:
Unauthorised drive at house 100 is causing damage to the green area - there is no right to drive on here. Children have nearly been hurt where the owner drives up, unsighted to them

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Meadoway, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 1 kerb stone very loose., 23rd April
item.description:
1 kerb stone very loose. Moves under foot, requires attention before someone trips
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dinglewell, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole cover moves when cars pass over it, 23rd April
item.description:
Third large cover up from the Dragon Pub towards Elkstone from Cheltenham. The cover moves when cars drive over it. It is getting worse. The cars driving over this manhole are on the North Bound side of the road, so towards the pub.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elkstone, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 10" Pothole much deeper than a golf ball., 23rd April
item.description:
Pothole at the give way line from Elkstone to Cheltenham. Kerb side so off side tyres hit it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large dip in pavement - TRIP HAZARD, 23rd April
item.description:
We have recently taken over ownership of the coffee shops at 255, Gloucester Road. We have since had complaints from customers and labourers of a large dip in the pavement causing one customer to trip. The issue has been presented for many months now and becomes even more dangerous when it rains and fills with water. This must be fixed urgently to avoid anymore falls.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 255;257, Gloucester Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2ft long pothole in the turning area, it really is bad., 23rd April
item.description:
Opposite no 40 Boverton Avenue. It has got worse over the Winter months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61, Boverton Avenue, Brockworth, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Keep Clear markings on Westfield Road Brockworth, 23rd April
item.description:
The keep clear road markings at the end of Westfield Road, Brockworth have worn out and need repainting. They are near a very busy road so are needed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Westfield Road, Brockworth, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Long stretch of uneven pavement which does not drain water and regularly causes surface flooding outside a school. 2nd time of reporting. This was marked as fixed but only 3 slabs have been replaced with some tarmac which clearly won't resolve the problem., 23rd April
item.description:
The stretch of pavement on the corner of Pitville circus road between the entrance to Byron Court flats and the traffic light crossing outside Berkhampstead school.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pittville Circus Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 23rd April
item.description:
email rec 15/04/2024 - There are two large trees outside my house. A large branch has fallen off one of the trees and gone through the windscreen of my daughter’s car. There are other branches on the trees that look unsafe. Please can you address this as a matter of urgency. I await your response.
Report on FixMyStreet
